page.title: 08Transport in Lorton
page.content: A regular bus service was withdrawn years ago on the grounds of economy. A small firm runs a minibus to Cockermouth on Friday mornings for shopping. This is used by 6_8 people. Most people own cars. This poses problems for people, especially school leavers with jobs in Cockermouth. The Parish Council drew up a list of drivers willing to give lifts in an emergency. People rely on friends. The roads are narrow and winding. In summer, tourists unused to such roads make driving dangerous. There have been accidents involving injuries. The nearest mainline stations are at Penrith and Carlisle _ both 30 miles away. Maryport on the W.Cumbria line is 12 miles away. National buses run from Cockermouth to London and other large cities.
